title: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
snippets: The FSB say they detained a "Ukrainian special services agent". Kyiv has not commented on the attack.
titles: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
summary: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) announced the detention of an individual claimed to be an agent of the Ukrainian special services. As of the latest updates, there has been no official response or comment from Kyiv regarding the detention or the allegations made by the FSB.

title: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
snippets: At least four people have been killed and 500 more injured in Bandar Abbas.
titles: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
summary: At least four individuals have died and another 500 have been injured in an incident in Bandar Abbas. The current status of the situation or the cause of the incident has not been provided in the available information.

title: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
snippets: Entire Strip, with a population of two million people, may be on the brink of famine as WFP runs out of supplies.
titles: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
summary: The Strip, home to two million residents, faces a potential famine crisis as the World Food Programme (WFP) reports running out of supplies. This situation puts the population at immediate risk of food insecurity.

title: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appoints aide as PLO deputy
snippets: Hussein al-Sheikh is a veteran leader of Abbas's Fatah movement and seen as a potential successor to him.
titles: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appoints aide as PLO deputy
summary: Hussein al-Sheikh is a seasoned leader within the Fatah movement, led by Mahmoud Abbas. He is recognized as a potential candidate to succeed Abbas in leadership.

title: Huge blast at key Iranian port kills eight and injures more than 750
snippets: A private security firm said it believed the affected containers had contained solid fuel destined for ballistic missiles.
titles: Huge blast at key Iranian port kills eight and injures more than 750
summary: A private security firm reported that the containers it inspected were believed to contain solid fuel intended for ballistic missiles. This conclusion suggests a focus on military capabilities, specifically regarding missile technology.

title: Mbappé out of Real Madrid starting XI for Copa del Rey final against Barcelona
snippets: Kylian Mbappé has been dropped from Real Madrid’s starting lineup for the Copa del Rey final against Barcelona.  The France star and Madrid’s top scorer will be on the bench at kickoff on Saturday in La Cartuja Stadium in Seville.  Mbappé hasn’t played since hurting his right ankle in a second-leg loss to Arsenal in the Champions League quarterfinals 10 days ago.
titles: Mbappé out of Real Madrid starting XI for Copa del Rey final against Barcelona
summary: Kylian Mbappé, Real Madrid's leading scorer, will not start in the Copa del Rey final against Barcelona due to a recent ankle injury. He last played 10 days ago when he was injured during a Champions League match against Arsenal. Despite this, Mbappé will be available from the bench during the game at La Cartuja Stadium in Seville.

title: 3 reasons why Patriots drafted Craig Woodson in Round 4
snippets: The Patriots added another safety when they drafted Craig Woodson in Round 4. Here's why the pick made sense
titles: 3 reasons why Patriots drafted Craig Woodson in Round 4
summary: The New England Patriots selected safety Craig Woodson in the fourth round of the draft, a strategic move aimed at strengthening their defensive backfield. Woodson's addition is seen as a logical step to bolster the team's defense, indicating the Patriots' focus on enhancing their safety position for upcoming seasons.

title: Seven-try Saints dent Bristol hopes of home play-off
snippets: Northampton Saints put a further dent in Bristol Bears' home Premiership semi-final hopes with a 48-31 victory at Franklin's Gardens.
titles: Seven-try Saints dent Bristol hopes of home play-off
summary: Northampton Saints defeated Bristol Bears 48-31 at Franklin's Gardens, impacting Bristol Bears' prospects for a home Premiership semi-final.

title: Wrexham promoted to Championship: Ryan Reynolds club to England's second tier after third straight promotion
snippets: The Welcome to Wrexham team has secured an unprecedented third consecutive promotion to the next higher division and will play only one level below the Premier League
titles: Wrexham promoted to Championship: Ryan Reynolds club to England's second tier after third straight promotion
summary: The Welcome to Wrexham football team has achieved a significant milestone by securing their third consecutive promotion. This advancement brings them just one level below the Premier League, marking an unprecedented achievement for the team in their climb through the football leagues.

title: 2025 NFL Draft grades for Round 2: Saints get C- for Tyler Shough selection, Bears earn A+ for Luther Burden

titles: 2025 NFL Draft grades for Round 2: Saints get C- for Tyler Shough selection, Bears earn A+ for Luther Burden
summary: Chris Trapasso evaluated the performances of teams on the second day of the 2025 NFL Draft, assigning grades to their selections. His analysis provides insight into which teams maximized their draft picks and which may have missed opportunities. The specific grades and team evaluations were not mentioned.

title: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
snippets: Sandy Cay is just kilometres from the Philippines’ military outpost at Thitu Island
titles: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
summary: Sandy Cay, located just kilometers away from the Philippines' military outpost at Thitu Island, is a geographical point of interest due to its proximity to a significant military location.

title: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
snippets: Russia acknowledges presence of North Korean troops on the ground for the first time
titles: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
summary: Russia has officially recognized for the first time that North Korean troops are present on the ground. This acknowledgment marks a significant development, though the specific details or implications of their presence were not disclosed.

title: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
snippets: World leaders gathered in Rome as US and Ukrainian presidents met for first time since Oval Office row
titles: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
summary: World leaders convened in Rome, marking the first meeting between the US and Ukrainian presidents since their disagreement in the Oval Office. This significant gathering aimed to address and potentially resolve issues stemming from their previous conflict.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
snippets: Proposal to fold the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board into the SEC will boost Donald Trump’s deregulatory agenda
titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move aligns with Donald Trump's broader agenda to reduce regulatory burdens.

title: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
snippets: Move by employees at Google’s AI arm follows discontent after weapons and surveillance pledge is dropped
titles: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
summary: Employees at Google's AI division have expressed discontent and taken action following the company's decision to abandon a pledge against using its technology for weapons and surveillance purposes. This move by the employees highlights their concerns over the ethical implications of the company's change in policy.

title: US government defunds research on misinformation
snippets: The US National Science Foundation cancelled funding for research on misinformation, disinformation and AI-generated deepfakes, even as misleading information runs rampant on social media
titles: US government defunds research on misinformation
summary: The US National Science Foundation has halted funding for research projects focused on misinformation, disinformation, and the development of AI-generated deepfakes. This decision comes at a time when the spread of misleading information on social media platforms is a significant concern.
